website_summaries.verdict: Using Bluetooth 4.0 technology, this heart rate monitor connects quickly to all devices.
pros: Comes with a 3-month money back warranty
Connects to GPS and Smartphones at the same time
Strap is adjustable from 65 inches to 95 inches
cons: Some customers commented that it disconnects easily with some devices

customer_reviews.title: Works with Peloton and comes with a battery
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Peloton bike. No setup required and it comes fully charged with a standard CR2032 battery. Very comfortable but suggest hand washing the strap rather putting it in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Feucht

customer_reviews.title: Works well with most HR tracker Apps
customer_reviews.text: There are more things to like about this HR tracker than the attractive price. There are clear instructions in English. I found the CooSpo App to be lacking ;however; I was able to download and experiment with several other brand apps on my android which recognized and worked fine with the CooSpo Dual Mode monitor. I was able to connect from the apps to the tracker using both Bluetooth and ANT+ . I finally settled for free app called "acentas HR monitor", which worked perfectly for my purposes. Highly recommend this HR monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Del L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with iphone and Strava.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier, I’ve been wanting to add a heart rate monitor that worked with my iPhone and Strava and this worked perfectly. It connected to my Bluetooth easily, I then went into my Strava settings (external sensors) and enabled HR and it came up instantly. I then headed out on a short ride to test it out and it worked flawlessly. I had some concern with the low price and a few of the poor reviews but so far couldn’t be happier. I will update this review should it stop working or give me headaches in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Naughton

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my TRX app and it had been wonderful! I get accurate readings on my workouts and it has been helping me achieve my fitness goals. The only issue I had was when it didn't want to connect to my TRX app. I found out the reason was because I had to have my location and Bluetooth on in order for it to connect to the app. This was not an issue with the tracker. Just the app. I hope that it continues to work this well and lasts a while. So far it has been great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Reese Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Bought to connect with Bowflex Max8
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help my wife and I get a better workout (by not having to use the hand heart rate monitors) with the Bowflex while still tracking our heart rate. Key benefit was how easy it was to "setup"... you literally put it on the strap, moisten the connection strips and put it on. You just step onto the trainer and start doing your workout and the systems connect automatically. I love that you can buy extra straps - so my wife and I can use one tracker and just swap out the strap. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Brand

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a 'Best Buy'
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these units. The first (still going strong) has been in use (cycling) for many months and performs flawlessly with my iPhone, Android and my Garmin Edge 1000. Also no problems using it with my Concept 2 Rowing Machine. An outstanding product at an outstanding price. Why two? The second for use at another location.
customer_reviews.author: CoopDoc

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: The CooSpo heart rate monitor connected easily to my Wahoo Element Bolt and to my Samsung S9 phone. I have been using it since November 2018 (about 4 months) on numerous bicycle rides (about 1000 miles). I had a different product before that needed a few minutes of workout before it started to work. The CooSpo HRM works immediately when I strap it on.
customer_reviews.author: astro

customer_reviews.title: Good Heart Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to replace an aging Pulse H6 heart monitor. Great price and the two channel radio worked perfectly to sync with my cell and the gym equipment. I use it with the Wahoo fitness app. They work great together. It would be nice to fine an app the combines a pedometer and HRM in one. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceCowboy

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because it is quite a lot less expensive than most others and I wasn't sure how much I was going to use it (answer: quite a lot, actually). I couldn't be more pleased. It connects quickly to my Android and seems to work just fine. I don't even bother wetting the contacts anymore.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: I've used it a half dozen times already and works great in reporting my heart rate riding the bike
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a NordicTrack Elite 5.4 Recumbent Cycle. The built-in heart-rate monitor in the handles are inconsistent and all over the map. I need a reliable heart-rate, so I came to Amazon and settled on the CooSpo Fitness Tracker. However, there was a small risk in not knowing if the unit would work with the new bike. I was pleasantly surprised to find the bike synced with it right away. There was no real set-up involved. I snapped the monitor together, wrapped it around my chest, and it was instantly recognized. I've used it a half dozen times already and works great in reporting my heart rate riding the bike.
customer_reviews.author: R. Partlow

customer_reviews.title: As good as an OEM.
customer_reviews.text: My brand name HRM was ANT only so didn’t work with the iOS version of the Kinetic trainer app. When it broke decided to go with this one because of the added BT capability. Functionally it works better than the original monitor because of the added BT. Same HR shows up on all my devices app. The battery change will be much easier. Definitely a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: JosephTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: I use the HR monitor for 2 types of activities, hiking & Biking 4-5 times per week. I've used it now for a few months now and it works and is easy to pair. It works on Strava via iPhone & Andriod phone. It works on my Garmin & on iPad connecting to Zwift. Just buy it as it really does help you see the true effort of your workouts.
customer_reviews.author: M. Biker

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: It works with the belt/strap supplied, and also with other ANT-type chest straps from Polar and Garmin that I owned from before.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Great Price: Will Not Last Long
customer_reviews.text: I am on my third one of these---the price is right, it syncs and connects just fine. BUT, the connections on the unit, and on the strap, are cheap. They corrode quickly, no matter how hard you work to dry them off after use. The result is corrupted (low) readings. I just did a 10k run and it gave me a whopping average of 87bpm (was probably 140). This is the second unit this has happened with---after the third one I'm moving on, despite the price.
customer_reviews.author: DrOakley

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I left my Garmin HR monitor at home by accident when away for many months. I wanted to have one, but didn't want to pay a lot, since I have one at home. I was a little concerned buying this at a fraction of the price of a name HR monitor. I have been pleasantly surprised. It paired easily with my Garmin 650 watch and matches the HR on machines at the gym. So at least if they are inaccurate, they are inaccurate equally. It could be 5 star, but don't know how it will last and then this review is less believable. Go ahead-- buy it.
customer_reviews.author: ckd

customer_reviews.title: A software engineer I'm not
customer_reviews.text: I, like most folks like things to be easy. Plug and Play, that's what I like. I haven't been able to get this thing connected to my Nordictrack elliptical E9.5 except for the very first time I used iti. Everything I read says the same thing. Put it on, wet the band so you have an electrode and make sure your bluetooth is turned on. I've done all of these things and can't get anything to happen. I even checked the battery. Nordictrack says anything with bluetooth will connect. So far, it ain't so, Joe. Perhaps you do get what you pay for but a resistor is a resistor whether it's made in china or Malaysia.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin Bob

customer_reviews.title: think of it as a disposable heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.text: When it works it’s accurate and easy to use, but that’s a big “if”. They are basically disposable and die after about 3 months or so. Changing batteries or straps doesn’t cure it. It just starts registering extremely low numbers and then dies. I’m on my second one and it apparently just died. First one lasted from October to January. Second one lasted from January to June. When it works I really liked it. Seamless with Zwift, Strava and Garmin. It just makes no sense to have to buy a new one very few months.
customer_reviews.author: David Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, accurate and flawless
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these last year when I started Zwifting. I also have a Garmin HR sensor, but it is only ANT+ and I needed a Bluetooth sensor to use Zwift on iOS. I am glad I found this sensor, it works flawlessly and accurately, never had a single problem - just remember to soak the belt in water before wearing it. It works so well that I just bought a second unit for my wife!
customer_reviews.author: Iris Funaioli

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after returning Garmin tickr which was frustratingly faulty and expensive. Coospo is inexpensive and works like a charm with Zwift app. So far after one month - effortless to get started and reliable. Strap is comfortable. The coospo app is very difficult to use but since I'm using this with Zwift and strava this is not an issue for me. UPDATE - worked great for approximately one year and then just stopped - as others remark , it pairs but reads low or not at all ; changed battery - changed strap - no improvement. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Enkay Ochez

customer_reviews.title: Followed Instructions, but its not connecting.
customer_reviews.text: I got my CooSpo 2 days ago, and decided to unbox and set it up today in preparation for an early bike ride in the morning. First disappointment ... according to the user manual it does not pair with Samsung S-Health. So I have to reactivate my Strava account. OK, done! The strap is comfy enough, and long enough for my 54" chest. That's a win! Turn on Bluetooth. It pairs, but won't connect. Huh!?. Try another app... scans for straps - None found. Maybe it's the battery? Can't be ... it was able to pair. Why can't it connect. Off to the store for a new $3 battery. Let's see?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped syncing after 6 months of light indoor use; ignored my warranty email
customer_reviews.text: Was using it for DDP Yoga. Worked reasonably okay, with some issues. For example, my heart rate would fluctuate from 115-130 to 85-95 in mere seconds at times no matter how tight or loose, or how much the position was adjusted. Yeah, very believable. But it's stopped syncing after 6 months. Tried it on other apps and phones. I don't sweat often with even intense yoga cardio, and everything is always dried and taken good care of. They say they have a warranty policy. Very nicely emailed them 9 days ago. They've ignored it. The more expensive HRM's might not be much better, but they'll at least not be from such a shady, shadowy company with a scam warranty policy.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but 6 months later...
customer_reviews.text: When i first bought this I was ecstatic! The price was reasonable and it worked well. I was able to pair with my phone easily, which was the main reason I purchased it. I wanted to be able to use it with Strava/Wahoo etc. And it did the job. However 6 months later I started having issues. I changed the batteries and it started working, but it would be sporadic. I changed the battery multiple times with sporadic effect. So maybe the unit is having some battery malfunction where it doesn't pick up the battery signal. needless to say i can't keep changing the battery for every use. I really wanted to love this unit.
customer_reviews.author: VE

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid HRM
customer_reviews.text: Had some trouble getting it to pair with the Wahoo app on my phone and it often took a while to connect afterwards (Bluetooth), but I think that my be more to do with my phone which seems to have its own mind when dealing with Bluetooth. When I switched to a Wahoo ELEMNT Bolt, the HRM was instantly found and reconnects quickly on startup (Ant+). Still not sure how to actually turn it off when not in use, but battery life has been fine anyways. The actual readings seem within margin of error when compared to my Fitbit which is the only thing I have to compare it with.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Works great, paired with my phone and apps with no trouble. I've used it on a few runs and it's great. I've used it with the Polar app, Strava and a couple others. I prefer the Polar app, but it's just personal preference. The fit is good, I'm 5'9'' 225lbs and there's plenty of adjustment both ways. Great product for the price, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott VdM

customer_reviews.title: The gamble pays off
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant to buy a $30 heart rate monitor, considering the prices of other comparable devices in this field. After two months of use six days a week, I'm happy to report this monitor is performing extremely well. The components show no signs of wear and are also very easy to use. I can't speak to the brand's app, but I've been pairing the monitor with Wahoo Fitness on Android with zero issues. Quickly connects via Bluetooth, and never drops the connection. If you're feeling skeptical about picking up an unknown brand (dare I say challenger brand), go ahead and make the jump on this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Works with Samsung heath app, not Google one
customer_reviews.text: If you want it to work with Samsung heath app, you should scan for device from the main app screen hamburger menu and select Accessories - Scan for accessories with your Bluetooth on but device not added. The accessories scan option on heart rate card will not work. If the above does not work, exist the app, go to Bluetooth and make sure the device is not added (if yes, click on hold to delete it), then go to the app and try again. Once it is first synced, it will connect automatically reliably going forward, so it is worth the effort to doing so.
customer_reviews.author: YoMat！

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product so I could put my heart rate up on my live stream while gaming on Twitch. Pairs with most any app but I needed it to work with Pulsoid. Paired instantly to the app on my android phone and works perfect. Uses readily available 2032 coil cell batteries. Extra straps if needed are available on Amazon for around 10.00 bucks here:  Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karl G.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable - broken after 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 4 months with pretty regular use (5 days a week/ 2 hours ea). Started to only show HR at about half values (80bpm vs 150/160) all of a sudden. Thought it was the battery - so I replaced that - only to have no improvement. Consistently under reports HR by a 50% factor for most workouts until about 30 minutes in, then it reports correctly. I have no idea what’s wrong with it. Suppose it being $30 has something to do with it. Anyway, spend an extra 10/20 for something better.
customer_reviews.author: frustratedperson

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Has this for a year now. Used it on average for ~40 miles per week - no issues whatsoever. It just works. Tips: - Make sure you moisten the contact patch when putting it on. - Rinse and dry after each use. Dry the metal contacts (both male/female side) with tissue paper right away to avoid rust - When noticing measured heart rate being 10-20 beats slower than usual, it's time to change battery. It's still going after a year. Just made the 1st battery change few days ago...
customer_reviews.author: W. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery performance
customer_reviews.text: Battery dies every few weeks. I’ve bought name brands that last the whole year. It works great when it’s not killing a battery. Maybe gets 4-5 hours out of a brand new name brand battery. Maybe I just got a dud but I wouldn’t reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Measures your Heart Rate Period Dot
customer_reviews.text: I have used this heart rate monitor for almost a year, on my Peloton as well as with my Wahoo Roam bike computer for actual bike rides. In total I have used the heart rate monitor on over 250 rides and easily 200+ hours of use. It works straight up. I have not had any issues with it, just make sure to wet the connection points before you put it on. Not sure what the other brand name monitors do that would cost 2-3 times as much. If you don't want to spend a ton of money, just buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great HR monitor, good value.
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my Bontranger (Trek) cyclometer. After taking the battery out and reinstalling, it worked perfectly. I've used it on short and long rides for a couple of months without any issues. I also paired it with Bluetooth and an App to make sure it worked there as well - no problems. It's also comfortable (for an HR monitor) on the chest. The little snaps that hold it on the strap allows you to remove and presumably wash the elastic strap.
customer_reviews.author: Manning Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last- I guess you get what you pay for....
customer_reviews.text: Mine lasted about 6 weeks. I bought it to use with my Tacx trainer, Apple TV, Zwift setup. After about 6 weeks and about 12 workouts it no longer sends an accurate heart rate. I even tried changing out the strap (which I have had to do with my garmin in the past) with no luck.
customer_reviews.author: doctorvader

customer_reviews.title: Low Cost Alternative to Garmin
customer_reviews.text: My 10 yr old Garmin strap finally had enough... So I needed a new strap (wrist measurement is just not good enough for real training). Looked around and found this strap. I use a Garmin 935 - and linking was no problem. As a long time strap user - I had no problem setting the length of the strap. So far it's very comfortable and has been working great (8 days so far). Looks like this was the right decision for me.
customer_reviews.author: glenn-the-runner

customer_reviews.title: Bought it to use with the DDP Yoga app and it doesnt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this HRM to strictly only use it on the DDP Yoga app, and tried to connect it, and it wont connect. The app doesnt see it at all, after 15 tries of turning bluetooth on and off, and going into the app, it still didnt see it. I gave up, Not really happy that I have a paper weight now
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: 2 bad units, I'm done.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these 3 months ago and it quit giving accurate reading, ordered 2nd unit and it didn't work out of the box. Left message for manufacturer with no response. None of packaging or device info has warranty info.
customer_reviews.author: Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the CooSpo Fitness Tracker and heart rate monitor every day since I received it a a little over a week ago. It works fantastic and I am really glad I got it. I am using it primarily as a heart rate monitor because I don't think my fitness tracking watch was accurate on the heart rate. This really helps me monitor my workouts. I am very pleased with this product and would definitely reccomend it to anyone looking for a heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen B

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility problem
customer_reviews.text: I just got a Schwinn 170 stationary bike and thought this would be compatible: manual said "uncoded POLAR-compatible models" are compatible." The blurb didn't explicitly mention POLAR but gave me the impression that it was compatible with about everything, and the headline did included the word POLAR, which is pretty dominant in the HRM market. Turns out it doesn't work. Description on Amazon should clearly say that it is not POLAR-compatible.
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, inexpensive, works with many different apps
customer_reviews.text: This heart rate monitor works great. I do not use the CooSpo app so I cannot comment on it, instead I paired the monitor with the UnderArmour MapMyRun app. It works perfectly. One thing to be aware of -- make sure you are wearing the monitor when you first pair it with your app. If it's not in contact with your skin, it won't power on. Also be sure to put a few drops of water on each sensor pad.
customer_reviews.author: square.wave

customer_reviews.title: Very Small Strap For Large Athletic Builds
customer_reviews.text: Well, it’s a heart rate monitor that easily connected to my Garmin computer and phone apps. One problem, a HUGE PROBLEM! This is by far the most constricting strap I’ve ever worn. I have a 46” chest and expected a much better fit below my pecs than what was delivered. This is far too uncomfortable and has to go back. Looks like Garmin is getting a repeat customer, their strap allows for a nearly 20” greater length.
customer_reviews.author: T4i Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Item worked perfectly once I was clear on how to setup my smartphone. It should be indicated in BOLD LETTERS and it CAPS in the description to state, "DO NOT PAIR THIS DEVICE WITH SMARTPHONE," ONLY ENABLE BLUETOOTH CONNECTION on SMARTPHONE! OPERATE DEVICE from compatible APP. The linked YouTube video in the description gives great video on how to wear the device, but the APP instructions are poor with no verbal instructions and could be better designed to have someone explain in English for Western customers on how to setup the Smartphone for both Android and Apple users on how to properly use with an compatible APP.
customer_reviews.author: Russell H.

customer_reviews.title: Update: You get what you pay for. In this case, junk. Thumbs down.
customer_reviews.text: Update: 12/26/19 Less than a year later, the unit has stopped working. Stay with the name brand units. You get what you pay for. In this case.. a piece of junk less than a year later. Your welcome, landfill. Thumbs down :-( Initial Review: Accuracy is pretty good for the price. A little bulky compared to competitors but half the price of more name-brand HR monitors. Great value and works fine with the Garmin watch using Ant+ and bluetooth using my wahoo app on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: No indication whatever that it's working
customer_reviews.text: Tried to pair it directly with the apps (Strava, Cyclemeter, Health) but they wouldn't pick it up. Connected okay via bluetooth to my iPhone 8 but won't stay connected for more than a minute or two. So, having tried to use it for a couple of weeks, I have no indication that the thing is even working correctly. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's DOA after just 90 days!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a major disappointment and complete waste of money the CooSpo Fitness Tracker Ant+ Heart Rate Monitor Chest Strap IP67 is. After just 90 days the chest strap transmitter has died. It's kaput. Why is it so difficult to make a reliable chest strap heart rate monitor? There are no moving parts. The transmitter doesn't need to be very powerful. Why do these things crap out so quickly? Caveat Emptor - don't spend your money on this one. It stinks!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Ennis

customer_reviews.title: Don;t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I had been using Jarv heart monitors and replacing them every 3 years, then my last one died and I bought this one. No matter what I tried I couldn't get it to connect to my iPhone 6s and get my heart rate. If you need to try repeatedly to get a product to work, it isn't worth the money or time. My Jarv heart monitors worked great, they just are not offered anymore. If you want frustration, but this product;)
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to work just fine. Accuracy seems better than my sportswatch HR monitor. (Which is as it should be. A chest strap should be much more accurate than a watch LED sensor.) Have only been using it for two weeks, but so far so good. Quality of the strap feels decent too. It seems like it will last, but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Vanya

customer_reviews.title: Remove the little piece of plastic first
customer_reviews.text: I just got this so I'll adjust the rating after some use. But I wanted to mention that I followed all instructions and it did not work at first. Then I checked the battery compartment and saw that there was a small plastic sheet under the battery. This no doubt keeps the battery from being discharged before you get it, but it has to be removed before things work. After removal, no problem pairing to Strava or Wahoo and readings seem accurate.
customer_reviews.author: xxq73

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it will
customer_reviews.text: The tracker is easy to set up, accurate (checked it against two finger pulse ox units and it matched them.) Also easy to "take apart" tracker from strap in order to clean the strap if needed. More comfortable to wear than I thought it would be. Syncs with every app I have on my Android phone. Cost is a fraction of it's competitors Purchasing another for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Chris farrugia

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up. Works Perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy about my new CooSpo Heart Rate Monitor! It was easily found by both my Android phone's bluetooth and my cycling computer's bluetooth and ANT+. It can connect to both at the same time, one with BT and the other with ANT+. It seems very accurate in its measurement. The strap is easy to put on, easy to adjust, and comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Peloton app = no
customer_reviews.text: I got this in the hopes that it would pair with the Peloton app, it doesn't. It does connect to the Wahoo app, like my cadence sensor, but when I reached out out to Peloton customer support, the rep told me that HRMs will track your metrics under their own apps, or whatever you have it paired to, but it will not show the data on the Peloton app. Even the Peloton HRM does not pair to the app. The only way to get your HRM metrics to show with Peloton are on the bike and the treat, per the rep I chatted with today
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: works with a Garmin Fenix 5s Watch
customer_reviews.text: very good synced right away my watch found this device and I was on my way... worth the money, and a very good option I'm still using it after a couple months 5 days a week, in the gym on treadmill, and elliptical machines
customer_reviews.author: iliketech

customer_reviews.title: Needs CR2032 battery and doesn't connect to Peloton
customer_reviews.text: It didn't connect to my Peloton. The battery was DOA so I had to put a new one right out of the box. It was not being recognized by the Peloton after multiple attempts except for one time and the one time it was recognized, it was unable to pair. Returning and getting something different. Also would be super helpful if this thing had a rechargeable battery instead of needing a CR2032 battery. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Elaina

customer_reviews.title: You must have more belly than chest to keep it in the proper spot.
customer_reviews.text: This item fell out of position about 8 times during my 30-minute workout. My workout heart rate was running between 118-145bpm (per my reliable heart rate monitor). When it falls out of position, it reads 58bpm. If your belly is not bigger than your chest, during any natural workout movement, the strap will fall down. No matter how tight you have the strap!
customer_reviews.author: jeepncolo

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to. And does it well.
customer_reviews.text: I've paired it with a Fenix 5, which tremendously increased the heart rate accuracy reading returned by it. Pairing was very easy. After 15 runs, I've still not changed the battery. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Marty S

customer_reviews.title: Great heart rate monitor at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great heart rate monitor and at a good price! I am an avid cyclist, riding 5 times/10 hr per week. I always ride with this heart rate monitor and pair it with Strava/Zwift/Wahoo. It consistently provides the heart rate data I want. The strap is easily adjustable and never slips. I would recommend this heart rate monitor over any of the "branded" ones (e.g. Wahoo) because it works just as well in every way and it is priced more reasonably!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Belanger

customer_reviews.title: Idiosyncrasies but well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The device linked with Strava and Sportractive easily, very accurate heart rate measurement so far. The device is always on so it does go through batteries pretty quickly. To solve this I just take the battery out between uses. You have to unsnap the monitor anyway to rinse the band after use so it's really no big deal. Also, a couple of times it didn't pick up my heart rate. I solved this by unsnapping and reattaching the monitor to the sensor band. For me this monitor has been well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Mallard

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a fitbit and didn't want to pull the trigger on another one yet. This coospo monitor feels more accurate and it connects well with the Wahoo app, one of the suggested apps. I have run with it about five times and the battery still seems pretty good. It's so inexpensive that at this point if it craps out, I'm ok with it and will upgrade to a better one now that I know I like HR monitors more than fitbits for runs.
customer_reviews.author: SPyle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good quality, economically priced!!!
customer_reviews.text: This HRM strap is pretty solid. I’ve used in two bike rides so far and one ice hockey game. The readings seem to be consistent and accurate. Pairing the HRM strap with my Suunto Spartan HRM watch was super easy, it also paired with my Strava app and MapMyFitness app with literally little to no effort. I’m pretty happy with the purchase, for under $30 I got a HRM strap that connects with my devices, seems to be of great quality and super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Homero A. Pardi

customer_reviews.title: Works great, simple to use and cost effective with excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This chest strap is pretty comfortable and pairs with my Garmin Vivofit quickly. I have not had any issues for a year before it started not reading all the time. I changed the battery and still had the same results. I then contacted CooSpo directly and Emma sent me out a new on right away. Before I was using an optical reader so I have no other chest straps to compare to but I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Cynicalman

customer_reviews.title: I like it best.
customer_reviews.text: This works great with my Garmin. Its easier to change a battery, and you won't ruin the unit when you change a battery. I have two other units, both from Garmin, to work with my Fenix 5. This one I like the best; it works the same but you can easily change the battery, and it cost less than half of either Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Not swim saavy
customer_reviews.text: For most of my workouts I use a wrist based device (Garmin Fenix) but in the pool that device turns off the HR feature. While in that mode you can use an external strap (which I use indoors with Strava as well.) So I got this to use in the pool. When getting ready, it connect, works great. But it doesn’t seem to have enough power to transmit through the water. Kind of a bummer, I tbough I had found a nice lower cost answer to the swim issue. Otherwise the product was fine, paired easy, no issues. Just doesn’t do exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: JDG

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. Ant works well, bluetooth not at all on two kickrs, two Android phones and two computers. My computer savvy son and I cannot get these to work in Bluetooth. They show up but no signal in Bluetooth, but work perfectly on same device in same session with ant. Was able to send one back.
customer_reviews.author: GB Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works with iFit on ProForm CLC exercycle but not Garmin Edge 520+
customer_reviews.text: It took a long time to get it working. I downloaded some of the suggested apps but I didn't get heart rate readings on them. Better instructions might have helped. It pairs with Garmin Edge 520+ and the blinking heart shows at the Garmin screen top but it did not read heart rate. After a few tries I got it to pair and work with the iFit console on the ProForm CLC exercycle which is the reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: jp sousa

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good . . . not so great for small chested people
customer_reviews.text: The monitor seems reasonably accurate and is detected by my devices, my problem is with the chest strap. My rib cage measures 28" and I have to clip the strap to my bra somehow (awkward) so that the strap does not fall out of place as I exercise. A tag on the strap is marked M-XXL which indicates it fits bigger people better than smaller ones. I guess I have to safety-pin or use needle and thread to make it shorter. Or buy a special sports bra with channels to thread the strap through. A hassle.
customer_reviews.author: PMayor

customer_reviews.title: needed it for my spin bike workouts
customer_reviews.text: 1. fit is great, price is right 2. easy to put on and connects right away 3. works great with WAHOO app 4. haven't tried to connect to gym equipment, have use with app on treadmill 5. overall very satisfied 6. would recommend to anyone in need of HR monitor Hope this review helps
customer_reviews.author: Jazzgryl52

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Seems mostly accurate
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this heart rate monitor in my twitch streams for the last month or so. It's been pretty good, but occasionally feels like the readings aren't completely accurate. Typically removing the band and reapplying with water gets things back in tune. All-in-all its been a fun and informational addition to my streams. It does what it's supposed to pretty accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: My OEM HRM from my watch broke, and I suffered for way too long with just my optical HR which was inaccurate and all over the place. Enter this strap, which worked perfectly out of the box and has given me no problems whatsoever. It is detected by my Fenix 5 within seconds and never drops out. If you're looking for a replacement monitor just buy this, you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: ILoveTheAmazonFairy

customer_reviews.title: Great heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is my first heart rate monitor and surprised at how easy to use it is. I am using it to link to my Peloton bike and it works flawlessly. Set-up was pretty easy and after that it links to Peloton automatically when I put it on. One trick I found to make sure it powers up is to Pre-wet the contact pads to ensure good conductivity to start.
customer_reviews.author: Keith the Chief

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For the price I would absolutely buy it again. Accuracy seems on point but my complaint is there is no way to tell battery life. I use it with my Nordic track 1700 with ifit and sometimes it takes 5min to connect. I assume it's the Nordic track but maybe it's low battery. There are no LED lights to show connection or information, just makes troubleshooting difficult. The Nordic track does not have a great interface for Bluetooth either. However good product and after using it for 3wks I'd have a hard time justifying $100 for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jess R. Switzer

customer_reviews.title: Connects quickly and works consistently well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my new treadmill which required a bluetooth HRM. It works consistently well, connects quickly. Some of my other bluetooth devices seem to be quirky when connecting or drop occasionally, but this HRM has been rock solid for me. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ChillKodama

customer_reviews.title: Connects easily and consistently
customer_reviews.text: First off, the product connects effortlessly to Peloton app, Garmin watch and Zwift app. It works well and is consistent with my HR readings. Furthermore, the company has been extremely good at communication and follow-up. We bought 2 of them, so I think that is as good as endorsement as it gets!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin D Hardwick

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't connect to phone; no help number provided
customer_reviews.text: I tried pairing the heart monitor with bluetooth on my iPhone—nothing. I took the battery out and put it back in—nothing. I looked for a help number in the instructions, online, anywhere—the only number I could find was in China. So I downloaded the Coospo app to see if I could connect that way somehow. No help. The app is badly translated from Chinese and is useless. I tried. Sending the product back.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Layzer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 days
customer_reviews.text: I wore it for 1 workout and it worked great with my Apple Health Application. The next day I tried it again and my phone connected to it but no data. Tried again the day after, same deal. The thing stopped working after I used it 1 time. Save your money and buy something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Vince S.

customer_reviews.title: Great until it stops working
customer_reviews.text: I used this heart rate tracker all throughout the summer but one day it just stopped working or started to give extreme values. I swapped the battery and still had the same issues. Soon enough it just stopped working completely. For the time it was working I have to say it got the job done at a great price. If you have the money and want better longevity purchase something else. If you’re on a budget id say get this in hopes of it working forever.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent connections and heart rate readings
customer_reviews.text: I was at first really happy to get this--connected to my apps and bike computer no problem. But then after using it for about 3 weeks, it just stopped working. It was having a hard time connecting to my devices and when it did it gave really weird HR readings. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: MMc

customer_reviews.title: It works very well
customer_reviews.text: The chest strap is comfortable and adjustable. The device snaps on firmly to the chest strap. It connects every time to my IGPSport bike computer and is extremely reliable and accurate. My watch HR monitor reading was all over the place so I trust this one. Works great and low maintenance!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Peloton
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because the Peloton HR monitor was sub-par at best. It would routinely not connect, disconnect, and sometimes not even turn on. The CooSport HR monitor connect fast, never loses connection and appears to be more durable. I’ve only used it for about a month, but this far zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Datro

customer_reviews.title: Will not set up on Strava, use Wahoo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor to improve my aerobic workouts. It is advertised as using multiple APPs and I like Strava. After a day of searching Strava's site, it was a no -go. I downloaded WaHoo and it recognized the monitor easily. I can connect WaHoo to Strava and did, but the heart rate info does not transfer. Would recommend not even working with Strava if you want to use this inexpensive monitor.
customer_reviews.author: malcolm machauer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I was a bit concerned before purchasing this item due to the negative comments that it either does not do its job or doesn't connect. I use it for a month now, almost every day, and I have not experienced any of those issues. The strap is correct and comfortable, maybe the unit itself is a bit bigger then the other brands' ones, but if it is not an issue for you, it is a good choice, especially when it comes to the pricetag.
customer_reviews.author: Ákos Herczeg

customer_reviews.title: Works, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Works with my Garmin. Really all I can ask for. For what it's worth, the Garmin prefers to connect over BT rather than ANT+, it does this with Garmin's dual strap as well. Chest straps work by detecting the electrical activity that causes your heart to beat. It's my understanding that as long as there's a good connection (wet the contacts) they are all equally accurate. I don't have an ECG to test with but based on a decade of using chest straps, this one has given me no reason to question its accuracy. No complaints about comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Croce

customer_reviews.title: Could be smaller
customer_reviews.text: It works well and easily paired with my Garmin 520+. My only complaint is that it’s not at all a low profile HR monitor. It’s much cheaper than, for example, the Garmin one, but the Garmin one doesn’t leave a big bulge below your chest like this one does.
customer_reviews.author: Brennen D.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Stay Connected
customer_reviews.text: This monitor doesn’t stay connected to your iPhone. I had to go in and reconnect every time I wanted to check my heart rate. After less than a week, the monitor stopped connecting to the app. Essentially useless if you need it for more than one day. That being said, it was not uncomfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: lsm20

customer_reviews.title: Refuses to stay connected to Rouvy either by BT or ANT+
customer_reviews.text: Had to pull the battery then reinsert to get it to pair, then it refuses to stay connected to Rouvy either by BT or ANT+. The only way to stay connected,,, kind of,,, is to grasp it but then the reading is no where near correct, as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Rfojr

customer_reviews.title: Good quality hrm and works with Peloton
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to use with our new Peloton bike. This was my first experience with a HRM. They were super easy to use and setup and so far so good after 25 rides. The company offered to send us a free band after our initial purchase, which was nice of them. In their confirmation they did ask politely for an unbiased review, however they shipped the extra band without waiting for a review or reply so I think that’s just smart marketing on their part. Recommended and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent with popular apps
customer_reviews.text: It does not work well with MyFitnessPal or record by Under Armour which I use daily it takes 15 minutes for the app to kick in after I've been running which is ridiculous and the accuracy is inconsistent with my actual heart rate and what my rate shows on my Fitbit. I don't recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Has a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: Ok I was pretty close to sending this back. I had the hardest time connecting it to my phone. The trick is that I needed to reboot my phone before trying to pair it. If I've had my phone connected to anything prior to pairing with the HB monitor it just won't work
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Pena

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as described yet half the price of a polar or Garmin strap. I was able to pair with my Garmin Forerunner 45 with ease and it works great with Endomondo. I also got the CooSpo arm band when I don't want to wear a chest strap. I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: D. C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Will give you a heart attact.
customer_reviews.text: It was work fine until my heart rate went sky high during a workout, But I was not going that hard. I wash the strap by hand and change the battery. it still during the same thing. I like this heart rate monitor but can not trust it. Think I will buy the new improve one.
customer_reviews.author: Gregjock

customer_reviews.title: Works with my iPhone X
customer_reviews.text: It's a cheap Heart Rate monitor and works with my iPhone 10. What else do you need?
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kvasnosky

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Peloton
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I strapped on this monitor it connected to my Peloton bike and is actually pretty comfortable, I forget it's there until I undress for the shower. Seems as accurate as other HRM's I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous value at less than $30
customer_reviews.text: Was very simple after I figured out how to sync the sensor with Polar Beat on Android. Just needed to go to "settings." Paired immediately. Never dropped the signal during my workout. Tremendous value at under $30.
customer_reviews.author: Shmuelman

customer_reviews.title: Great budget monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor. I have tried pretty much every heart rate app in the Google play store. Runkeeper by far is the best I found to work with this monitor. Very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: rgncajun68

customer_reviews.title: Beats Polar's H7 by a landslide
customer_reviews.text: I've had so many problems with my several Polar H7s and had never heard of CooSpo, but was so frustrated I had to try and very glad I did. Works very well with Polar Beats and Wahoo.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Good value for your money
customer_reviews.text: This heart rate monitor is accurate and it is much less expensive than other brands. I use it with a compatible bike computer and the readings are accurate, with no lags. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanna V.

customer_reviews.title: Great band, special for use with Wahoo app
customer_reviews.text: I used this to track my heart rate when I practice MTB and it works great, I could sync with strava before the restrictions of third party monitors and now, I can syncronize my information with Strave using Wahoo ( I recommend this app 100%).
customer_reviews.author: Greg Bartels

customer_reviews.title: Works great and at a reasonable price too
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. I was able to connect with my Apple watch via Bluetooth and an IGPSPORT IGS50E bike computer via ANT+ at the same time. The strap is comfortable and easy to attach. I did initially have issues with the HRM dropping it’s connection, but replacing the battery solved this issue. Also, the battery is very easy to switch out.
customer_reviews.author: GA Printz II

customer_reviews.title: YES!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best HRM I’ve ever had. It is spot-on accurate. I can connect to my computer via Bluetooth and my watch via ANT+ at the same time; IDK why I would need both at the same time but I can do it. It is really nice to be able to swap between recording devices without repairing. The HRM’s that have come with my watch’s, and all the replacements I’ve bought are a waste of product and money. The only downside is that it is a little thicker than the watch branded ones, but that is a small price to pay for accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: Liked this at first but started having problems with it. Put in a new battery and it helped initially. Now it just doesn't work. I had less than a month. Now because I'm 2 days past the one month return date they won't they won't take it back!
customer_reviews.author: James R. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable dual-band HRM
customer_reviews.text: These are great, I have two, one for 18 months and another for 6 months. I tried the BT only version and it wasn’t as reliable as the dual ANT+/BT ones even just using BT to connect to a Stages bike. So if you need a chest HRM try this - it’s been more reliable for me than my original Garmin ANT HRM.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Green

customer_reviews.title: It was cheap and it works with the DDPY app
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use with the DDP Yoga app and it works just fine for that.
customer_reviews.author: Ottakee

product_meta.title: CooSpo Heart Rate Monitor Chest Strap, Bluetooth 4.0 ANT+ Waterproof HR Sensor for Wahoo Peloton Zwift Polar DDP Yoga Map My Ride Garmin Sports Watches
feature_bullets: Track Real Time Heart Rate - CooSpo ANT+ heart rate monitor helps you track and capture real time heart rate, training zones and calories burned on your smartphone or tablet with compatible training apps.
Bluetooth & ANT+ Pairing - Allows you to connect to bike computers, gym machines, phones, and smart-watches to allow you to track your training even if you exercise in a variety of different ways.

Soft & Comfort - The soft textile chest strap seamlessly adapts to your body shape, bringing full freedom of movement to your training. Available in a selection of colours, make sure you have extras for replacing. B0895Q2ST7
Notes - Make sure you place the monitor firmly in place below your chest muscles and you need to moisten the strap. For more info, please visit: https://youtu.be/6JBHwHveelg
Warranty - Every purchase comes with ONE YEAR HASSLE-FREE WARRANTY and superior after-sales customer service provided by CooSpo.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
